title: Bike Hacks: DIY Mini Chain Lube Bottles – Spencer Harding
content:
Sometimes the best hacks are so frustratingly simple. We’ve all forgotten to lube our chains before heading out for an all-too-noisy ride. Today Spencer shares a Bike Hack that will ensure you’re never without some trusty bike lube…

The initial inspiration for this hack came from Thayne, the owner of Tourist in Santa Fe. Thane sold me some 1 ml dropper bottles for carrying Aqua Mira on camping trips. The standard Aqua Mira bottles are bulky – as a recovering ultralight nerd, I need to drop grams where I can.

Thane even sold me a third little bottle for remixing some of the chemical water treatment. I felt so silly for not having thought to use little droppers for so long. They are amazingly useful to have in the bottom of my bag for emergency water treatment.

The second part came from my friend Colin. We were bikepacking, and I broke out my little bottles of Aqua Mira to treat some gnarly water on a trip through the Ironwood National Monument. After the trip, Colin picked up a 60-pack of the little droppers, which seemed to be the smallest quantity he could find. He gave me a handful after that trip. That’s when the light went off in my head…

For years, I have been buying small droppers of fancy bike lube. They usually cost $4-6, so I don’t usually think much of it, but it all adds up. Aside from the cost, the major drawback of these tiny bottles of lube is that they aren’t translucent, so I won’t realize I’m out or nearly out.

After Colin handed me a handful of these 2 ml dropper bottles, I knew immediately I needed to make small bottles of lube for all my bikes. Each one of my bikes has some sort of bag, so these are easy to just toss in, just in case. There is no reason to ever be without lube on a ride anymore. Lately, it’s been extremely dry and dusty down in the desert and I’ve found that these little lube droppers help me and my friends stay squeak-free on rides.

The hack is simple:

  • Take whatever lube works best for you; you probably have a relatively large bottle around.
  • Go in on an order of little dropper bottles with some buddies.
  • Put the lube in the tiny dropper bottles.
  • Use and easily refill when you use it all up!

My little bottles were sourced from Amazon. If you want larger droppers, they seem to come in a multitude of sizes. Get a batch and make them for all your friends. Even better, when someone asks you for lube, just hand them one of your DIY lube bottles. Help all your friends and be the hero of dry and creaky drivetrains.
